answers.answer: HiThanks for the post!You should look at hypothyroidism and diabetes for diagnosis. Both cause problems with blood vessels causing peripheral constriction of vessels. Peripheral blood vessels can be studied by Doppler study to see if the blood is flowing through them properly.I think you should discuss this with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: for the past 2 yrs throughout winter my arms and outer thighs are ice cold inspite that I am wearing warm. I feel they are frozen and the rest of the body is normal. I have done MRI of the spine which is normal the skin specialist says noproblem.  Am afraid as I do not know what I am suffering from.
title: chilled arms thighs
